sense.name: Put into a box; enclose or confine as if in a box.
sense.examples: Box the gift, please. Don't box me in here! We need to box up the rest of the chocolates before closing. The other drivers boxed in the 11 car.

sense.name: Hit with the fist, possibly as in a boxing match.
sense.examples: She really knows how to box. I'll box your ears! He boxed for hours that day after work.

sense.name: BOX OUT: deny access to something.
sense.commentary: Is: BOX OUT Note: Source domain is in basketball but may be used metaphorically.
sense.examples: She boxed out her opponent, one of the most imposing guards in the WNBA. Don't box me out of this deal! They boxed him out of their interaction.
